place.name: LLANGATWG FEIBION AFEL
place.gazetteerText: LLANGATTOCK-VIBON-AVEL, a parish in the district and county of Monmouth; 1¾ mile W of the river Monnow at the boundary with Herefordshire, and 4 NW of Monmouth r. station. Post town, Monmouth. Acres, 4,914. Real property, £4,100. Pop., 497. Houses, 106. The property is divided among a feW. The Hendre is the seat of J. E. W. Rolls, Esq. Limestone is worked. The living is a vicarage, united with the p. curacies of Llanvanair and St. Mauglian, in the diocese of Llandaff.. Value, £365. * Patron, J. E. W. Rolls, Esq. The church is good; and there are charities £23. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
